title: Welcome to CME 295!
content: Welcome to Transformers & Large Language Models course! Please check the syllabus and course schedule. First class begins on January 27th.

title: Assignment 1 Released
content: Assignment 1 on 'Introduction to NLP and Attention Mechanisms' has been released. Due date: February 5th, 11:59 PM. Check Canvas for submission guidelines.

title: Course Registration Deadline Extended
content: Registration deadline has been extended to January 30th due to high demand. Please complete your enrollment as soon as possible.

title: Lecture 1 Recording Available
content: Recording for Lecture 1 (Introduction to NLP) is now available on Canvas. Slides and code examples have also been uploaded.

title: Office Hours Schedule Updated
content: TA office hours have been updated. Check the course staff section for new timings. Additional office hours added before assignment deadlines.

title: Assignment 1 Submission Reminder
content: Reminder: Assignment 1 is due on February 5th at 11:59 PM. Late submissions will incur penalty as per syllabus. Submit via Canvas.

title: Guest Lecture Announcement
content: We will have a guest lecture by Dr. Sarah Chen from OpenAI on February 12th about 'Scaling Laws in Large Language Models'. Don't miss it!

title: Assignment 2 Released - BERT Implementation
content: Assignment 2 on 'BERT Fine-tuning for Classification Tasks' is now available. Due date: February 22nd. This assignment requires GPU access - check compute resources guide.

title: Midterm Exam Date Announced
content: Midterm examination scheduled for February 26th, 3:30 PM - 5:30 PM in the regular classroom. Covers lectures 1-8. Study guide will be released next week.

title: GPU Access for Assignments
content: Google Colab Pro accounts are available for students who need additional GPU resources. Contact TAs with your student ID to get access credentials.

title: Class Cancelled - February 16th
content: Class on February 16th is cancelled due to institute holiday. Next class will be on February 19th. Please review transformer architecture materials.

title: Midterm Study Guide Released
content: Midterm exam study guide and practice questions are now available on Canvas. Review sessions scheduled for February 24th and 25th.

title: Assignment 2 Deadline Extension
content: Due to technical issues with the server, Assignment 2 deadline has been extended to February 24th, 11:59 PM. No further extensions will be granted.

title: Final Project Guidelines Released
content: Final project guidelines and topic suggestions are now available. Project proposal due March 8th. Teams of 2-3 students allowed.

title: Midterm Results Posted
content: Midterm exam results have been posted on Canvas. Overall class average: 78%. Office hours available for grade discussions this week.

title: Assignment 3 Released - GPT Fine-tuning
content: Assignment 3 on 'GPT Model Fine-tuning and Text Generation' is now available. Due date: March 15th. Includes both coding and theoretical components.

title: Research Paper Presentation Slots
content: Sign-up sheet for research paper presentations (Week 9) is now open. Each student must present one recent paper on LLMs. First-come, first-serve basis.

title: Final Project Proposal Deadline Today
content: Final project proposals are due today by 11:59 PM. Submit via Canvas with team details and project scope. Feedback will be provided by March 12th.

title: Industry Panel Discussion
content: Special industry panel on 'LLMs in Production' scheduled for March 19th. Panelists from Google, Microsoft, and Anthropic will discuss real-world applications.

title: Assignment 3 Submission Reminder
content: Assignment 3 due today at 11:59 PM. Make sure to include all required files and documentation. Check submission checklist on Canvas.

title: Final Project Progress Report Due
content: Final project progress reports due March 22nd. Include current status, challenges faced, and timeline for completion. 2-page limit.

title: Final Presentation Schedule Released
content: Final project presentation schedule for April 2nd and 4th has been posted. Each team gets 15 minutes (12 min presentation + 3 min Q&A).

title: Course Evaluation Survey
content: Please fill out the course evaluation survey by April 1st. Your feedback is valuable for improving the course. Anonymous and confidential.

title: Final Project Submission Deadline
content: Final projects due April 3rd, 11:59 PM. Submit code, report, and presentation slides. Late submissions will not be accepted without prior approval.
